1.text: the Lion who Wouldn't Try. Liza Esterhuyse. Andre Kieswetter. Nick Mulgrew
1.summary: A lion who refuses to try new things meets a wise mouse.

3.text: It was a sunny day in the jungle. All the animals were out playing.
3.summary: Sunny jungle day, animals play and have fun.

4.text: "Come play with me, Lion," said Cheetah. "Catch me if you can!" ZOOM-ZOOM! went Cheetah. "I don’t want to play," said Lion. "I’ll lose."
4.summary: Cheetah challenges Lion to a playful chase, but Lion declines.

5.text: “Come play with me, Lion,” said Elephant. “We can throw rocks!” KA-POW! KA-POW! went Elephant. “I don’t want to play,” said Lion. “I’ll lose.”
5.summary: Elephant invites Lion to play, but Lion is afraid of losing.

6.text: “Come play with us, Lion!” said the monkeys. “Who can eat the most bananas?” POP! POP! POP! went the monkeys. “I don’t want to play,” said Lion. “I’ll lose.”
6.summary: Monkeys invite Lion to a banana-eating contest.

7.text: "Come play with me, Lion," said Springbok. "Let's jump high!" ZOOP! ZOOP! ZOOP! went Springbok. "I don't want to play," said Lion. "I'll lose."
7.summary: Springbok invites Lion to play, but Lion is afraid of losing.

8.text: "Come play with me, Lion," said Crocodile. "It’s a swimming competition!" SPLASH! SPLASH! went Crocodile. "I don’t want to play," said Lion. "I’ll lose."
8.summary: Crocodile invites Lion to a swimming competition, but Lion is afraid to lose.

9.text: Elephant and Crocodile had the swimming competition without Lion. Crocodile was quicker than Elephant, but each time Crocodile got ahead, Elephant tickled him! TEE-HEE-HEE! went Elephant and Crocodile.
9.summary: Crocodile swims fast but Elephant tickles him, making him laugh.

10.text: Lion sat sadly by himself, watching Crocodile and Elephant swim.
10.summary: Lion watches Crocodile and Elephant swim, feeling sad and alone.

11.text: "Why are you sad, Lion?" asked Mouse. "Because I don't want to play," said Lion. "I'll lose."
11.summary: Lion is sad because he doesn't want to play and lose.

12.summary: Lion looks at banana peel near stone wall.

13.text: Lion slipped on a banana peel! WHEEEEEE! went Lion. “That looks like fun!” said all the other animals.
13.summary: Lion slips on a banana peel and other animals find it fun.

14.text: Lion played, and he was happy.
14.summary: Lion plays with friends and feels happy.

15.summary: Blank page with decorative banana illustrations

16.summary: Mouse enjoys a fun ride on a flying banana.

17.text: Did you enjoy the story? Would you like to play a game?
17.summary: Questions about enjoying the story and playing a game.

18.text: Can you retell the story? Use the pictures to help you!
18.summary: Retell the story using the pictures as a guide.

19.text: What different emotions did you see throughout the story? Use the pictures to help you! Why did Lion not want to play?
19.summary: Analyze emotions and reasons in the story.

20.text: Did you enjoy reading together today?
20.summary: Ask if the reader enjoyed reading together today.
